content.raw:
I think we should be able to display the parameters in Jenkins actually, since they're available in the xml:
~~~
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<testsuites tests="16" failures="0" disabled="0" errors="0" time="0.002" name="AllTests">
  <testsuite name="TestRuns/TupleTest" tests="16" failures="0" disabled="0" errors="0" time="0.002">
    <testcase name="Hello/0" value_param="("AAA", "111")" status="run" time="0" classname="TestRuns/TupleTest" />
    <testcase name="Hello/1" value_param="("AAA", "222")" status="run" time="0" classname="TestRuns/TupleTest" />
    <testcase name="Hello/2" value_param="("AAA", "333")" status="run" time="0" classname="TestRuns/TupleTest" />
    <testcase name="Hello/3" value_param="("AAA", "444")" status="run" time="0" classname="TestRuns/TupleTest" />
    <testcase name="Hello/4" value_param="("BBB", "111")" status="run" time="0" classname="TestRuns/TupleTest" />
    <testcase name="Hello/5" value_param="("BBB", "222")" status="run" time="0" classname="TestRuns/TupleTest" />
    <testcase name="Hello/6" value_param="("BBB", "333")" status="run" time="0" classname="TestRuns/TupleTest" />
    <testcase name="Hello/7" value_param="("BBB", "444")" status="run" time="0" classname="TestRuns/TupleTest" />
    <testcase name="Hello/8" value_param="("CCC", "111")" status="run" time="0" classname="TestRuns/TupleTest" />
    <testcase name="Hello/9" value_param="("CCC", "222")" status="run" time="0" classname="TestRuns/TupleTest" />
    <testcase name="Hello/10" value_param="("CCC", "333")" status="run" time="0" classname="TestRuns/TupleTest" />
    <testcase name="Hello/11" value_param="("CCC", "444")" status="run" time="0" classname="TestRuns/TupleTest" />
    <testcase name="Hello/12" value_param="("DDD", "111")" status="run" time="0" classname="TestRuns/TupleTest" />
    <testcase name="Hello/13" value_param="("DDD", "222")" status="run" time="0" classname="TestRuns/TupleTest" />
    <testcase name="Hello/14" value_param="("DDD", "333")" status="run" time="0" classname="TestRuns/TupleTest" />

</testsuites>

content.html:
I think we should be able to display the parameters in Jenkins actually, since they're available in the xml:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<testsuites tests="16" failures="0" disabled="0" errors="0" time="0.002" name="AllTests">
  <testsuite name="TestRuns/TupleTest" tests="16" failures="0" disabled="0" errors="0" time="0.002">
    <testcase name="Hello/0" value_param="("AAA", "111")" status="run" time="0" classname="TestRuns/TupleTest" />
    <testcase name="Hello/1" value_param="("AAA", "222")" status="run" time="0" classname="TestRuns/TupleTest" />
    <testcase name="Hello/2" value_param="("AAA", "333")" status="run" time="0" classname="TestRuns/TupleTest" />
    <testcase name="Hello/3" value_param="("AAA", "444")" status="run" time="0" classname="TestRuns/TupleTest" />
    <testcase name="Hello/4" value_param="("BBB", "111")" status="run" time="0" classname="TestRuns/TupleTest" />
    <testcase name="Hello/5" value_param="("BBB", "222")" status="run" time="0" classname="TestRuns/TupleTest" />

    <testcase name="Hello/9" value_param="("CCC", "222")" status="run" time="0" classname="TestRuns/TupleTest" />
    <testcase name="Hello/10" value_param="("CCC", "333")" status="run" time="0" classname="TestRuns/TupleTest" />
    <testcase name="Hello/11" value_param="("CCC", "444")" status="run" time="0" classname="TestRuns/TupleTest" />
    <testcase name="Hello/12" value_param="("DDD", "111")" status="run" time="0" classname="TestRuns/TupleTest" />
    <testcase name="Hello/13" value_param="("DDD", "222")" status="run" time="0" classname="TestRuns/TupleTest" />
    <testcase name="Hello/14" value_param="("DDD", "333")" status="run" time="0" classname="TestRuns/TupleTest" />

</testsuites>
